bibl.author: Walt Whitman
bibl.title: Walt Whitman to Damon Y. Kilgore, 24 September [1876]
bibl.orgName: Private collection of Florence A. Hoadley

revisionDesc.change: extracted transcription from Major Authors cd

body.p: Send me word immediately when (day & hour) & where the Paine bust affair is to come off. I see an announcement in the paper that I am to read a poem on the occasion. I do not propose to read a poem—but I will promise to be there, & speak just a little (say 10 minutes)—if I can be put on the early part of the program (as waiting fags me out entirely)—& perhaps it would be necessary that I should be sent for in a carriage. I would advise that you have some good music, & no long-winded address at all. (Couldn't you get some good baritone singer to sing Paine's fine lively old song of "the Liberty Tree"?)

postscript.p: best respects to Mrs Kilgore—love to Charley—
